Posts.Content: Hi Foxglove just wanted to say good luck for Tuesday, I am having mine the same day so we'll have to compare experiences and kick cancers butt together  Angela x x
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy options help please!

Posts.Content: So happy for you x x
Posts.Title: Results Are In :)

Posts.Content: First things first Kathryn123  You get the op over and feel the buzz of hounding this critter then sit back and ponder the chemo. I had similar op just over a month ago and it was fine. Yes I was scared going in but honestly they are amazing the way they care for and reassure you. Couldn't believe that the pain was not a problem and the drain although always in the way was out in 6 days. Hang in there honey and please accept this big HUG!!!! Angela x
Posts.Title: Lymph node recurrence after axillary clearance

Posts.Content: First things first Kathryn123  You get the op over and feel the buzz of hounding this critter then sit back and ponder the chemo. I had similar op just over a month ago and it was fine. Yes I was scared going in but honestly they are amazing the way they care for and reassure you. Couldn't believe that the pain was not a problem and the drain although always in the way was out in 6 days. Hang in there honey and please accept this big HUG!!!! Angela x
Posts.Title: Lymph node recurrence after axillary clearance

Posts.Content: Thanks Leolady56 so with last chemo being the 1st November it's likely that I will be done with RT as well before Christmas which would be very nice.
Posts.Title: October 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: How long after chemo do you have to wait for radiotherapy to start?
Posts.Title: October 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hi Jax68 my oncologist recommended milled flax seed sprinkled on breakfast cereal or fruit and yogurt each morning. I used two tablespoons and it tastes fine, doesn't go jellish and does the job just fine. It's easy to find in supermarket or health food store but it must be the milled variety not just the seeds. I have kept it up and have it most morning as it doesn't make you go lots and I feel it is a healthy adjustment to my diet. Angela x
Posts.Title: Slight constipation

Posts.Content: Good luck Yme with you RT on the 12th...I never did catch you up did I! You are going to have to wait now for that cup of tea until I'm done. I'm sure you are going to ace this x Best of luck Cuppatime with your RT on 13th there is light at the end of that tunnel x
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Had my compression sleeve less than two weeks and already it's become a habit to put it on. Together with a session of MLD things are moving in the right direction. Have 4 more sessions of MLD booked so hopefully things will be well in check by then. MLD works like magic!! Angela x
Posts.Title: arm bandaging for lympodema

Posts.Content: I have never even heard of bandaging so will watch this thread with interest to see what evolves.  Angela
Posts.Title: arm bandaging for lympodema

Posts.Content: Looks fabulous x
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Seaspirit44 is that Shropshire?
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: The beautiful Shropshire Hills.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Oh how exciting although still not sure...Spain or Portugal they both played yesterday? My daughter and her husband have just got back from two weeks in Croatia and watched them win two matches while they sat in a beach bar...very excited locals and wonderful atmosphere.  Are you a football fan? Angela x
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Went out this evening with some friends for a post match curry. Decided I'd dress up a bit, the first time really since my op and so put on a black lacy number that is very cool. Had to wear a camisole under it as its quite see through and off I went feeling like the dogs back wheels!! Half way through the meal I suddenly realised that I was probably not going to be able to get said top off as arm still hasn't got full movement back so decided to ask one of my friends to walk back to my car and help me get it off...I would be fine driving home in a camisole cos it was still 29 degrees out there. When we got to my car which was parked in a quiet back street I decided to try myself to get it off because I thought it would be good exercise and indeed I managed it....but then I looked around and realised I was being observed by 3 people watering their gardens, a pizza delivery man and a taxi driver depositing four people into the restaurant that I had just come from....now where did they all come from!! Lots of smile, some a bit sheepish and all with a story to tell when they get home.  I really shouldn't be allowed out!!
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Been out for a walk before it gets too warm. I am trying to satisfy my Fitbit and achieve the goals I've set so this morning I added a trip to the post box in order to get my 30 active minutes in the bag...fell short yesterday. Well fell even shorter this morning and have just realised why...I'm doing the route quicker...RESULT!!!
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Amalie....Well what a coincidence!! My daughter was staying in a little village just outside of Split they had a wonderful time and said they'd go back again.  I'm only a sports fan when the stakes are high. I enjoy the Olympics especially the Winter ones and World Cups when we are in them so I shall be watching tonight.  Take care Angela.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Amalie, is it Malta?
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Please feel free to do mine...
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: moomy I watched and listened for him yesterday afternoon to fly over Bedford!! Apparently he was very late so I missed him...gutted Today I'll try again as the Lancaster is promised... should hear that amazing roar as he flies over. Angela
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: I bet that amount of achievement feels good Leolady56 whoop whoop! I have watered the garden and got my dinner on so I am feeling super human today
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: And I slept like a log after that little adventure Violetsniff
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: I haven't walked for weeks, just felt too poorly but today the sun is out and I have been in the garden. Have got my broad beans in and have cut back a few shrubs and it feels good. So pleased to be feeling able again, now must charge that fitbit!! Angela x
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Yes Moomy I have done my walk for today before it gets too hot and the path I was on looked just the same...we really need some rain.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: A Goer Wig sounds good as I shall be wearing a real goer of a wig very soon. Thanks Violetsniff x
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Day 10 after chemo and I'm back!! I was beginning to think it would never happen. Woke at 6am to a fresher morning and the smell of bacon wafting through my bedroom window. With some urgency I got showered and dressed and head downstairs to search for a packet of bacon in the freezer.  Ventured out for my first walk...just a 15 minute round trip but it felt wonderful to be out there. Back now waiting for the bacon to thaw. Love to you all Angela x
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Lovely story, there are lots of good people out there and glad you found one today seaspirit44
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Does anyone know if there is an end of treatment bell in the radiotherapy department at Addenbrookes?
Posts.Title: A Bell To Ring

Posts.Content: Hi Val36 it's a tough decision to have to make and of course only you can make it. I had three Fec and had very few side effects and was back to doing normal things after about 7-10 days. I wasn't sick which was a great fear of mine and just felt tired and washed out. Then went on to T and it was a different story BUT after the first had the dose lowered to a more manageable one and now I'm finished, Your oncologist will tailor treatment so that it is manageable, their prime objective is to help us. It's a time consuming and rubbish time but it is doable.  Take care Angela x
Posts.Title: What to do for the best

Posts.Content: Started training for the Race for Life yesterday and did 2.5K around Priory Park lake. Wasn't gasping for breath at the finish and legs still working today!! Will take my phone next time and get a photo or two, it was lovely with baby ducks by the dozen. Happy walking x
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Of course Dreamthief I am jumping the gun as usual still waiting for my surgery and already imagining myself ring an end of radiotherapy bell!! Thanks for your reply Angela
Posts.Title: A Bell To Ring

Posts.Content: Thanks mistymoley...just want it over and done with now
Posts.Title: Difference between Grade 1 and Stage 1

Posts.Content: I have been diagnosed with Grade 1 Invasive Ductal Cancer. Positive Lymph node. Hormone receptor positive. Booked in for Wide Local Excision and axillary node clearance on 29th May. They think they might have to use a guide wire to locate the lump, has anyone had experience of this? I'm feeling good about how quickly this is all happening and have great family support but would love to hear from anyone who's been there done that.
Posts.Title: Difference between Grade 1 and Stage 1

Posts.Content: Could use some clarity about this please.
Posts.Title: Difference between Grade 1 and Stage 1

Posts.Content: Sorry put that post in the wrong place really...new here and still finding my way around ...must try harder!!
Posts.Title: Difference between Grade 1 and Stage 1

Posts.Content: Thanks to Jess and Dreamthief that is just what I was looking for, all is clear now.
Posts.Title: Difference between Grade 1 and Stage 1

Posts.Content: Happy Birthday Pickles 18
Posts.Title: Oncotype dx test unclear as what i should do next :(

Posts.Content: ali owl, we will be able to compare notes and whinge together   What are you getting and how many?
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Yes all very real now, when are you starting? ali owl
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Leolady56 Yes had great fun with Weeblemum yesterday...talked for about 4 hours solid!! I am in Bedford so all treatments in The Primrose unit at Bedford apart from Radiotherapy which will be at Addenbrookes, Cambridge.  Love Angela x
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: hi Supermom Yes this is my first session and going well. Day 3 now and am trying not to look for side effect. Just taking a day at a time and doing as I'm told. The only things I have noticed are a slight sinus tension and muzzy head which is no problem at all really since i'm not going anywhere or trying to do anything much while I have eager helpers. Last night tongue felt a bit sore and wondered of I would have sore mouth this morning but no just did too much talking yesterday I think...will be eating no more cherries as they did taste very sour yesterday and everyone assured me that they weren't.  Good luck for 19th you will be one step nearer beating this critter. Angela
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Leolady56 I'll claim the short fat hairy legs for another week or so! And Aliowl what are you like ?
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi Karen this site has a good video of what happens during chemo http://www.cancernet.co.uk/
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Onco appointment on time and home already.... My biggest grumbles about my first session were the constipation and the post steroid crash. As I had no sickness at all he is going to reduce the steroids next time which will hopefully mean that these problems will ease....such a nice man!!
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Good morning Aliowl Yes i am up and have just come back from a lovely walk...if only it could stay like this all day, it's beautiful out there. Time for breakfast now x
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: 1 down and 5 to go!! All went in two attempts to get the cannula in then over an hour to slowly push the Epirubicin in...but in it went  then the last two were very quick. A positive experience and fabulous nurses.  Tried a private message earlier but it wouldn't send Weeblemum Hope radiotherapy was a good experience Yme
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: I'm getting Fec-T so 3 x FEC followed by 3 x T
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: I am having my first chemo without PICC line! Time did not allow to have one fitted before so mine goes in 24th ready for round 2. EEEK indeed it's a mix of terrifying and lets get this show on the road isn't it x
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: ali owl....And I can't see your posts on the discussion either...just happened to catch them on the latest post page!!!
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Well I am all marked up,measured, photographed, tattooed and ready to go. Different hospital to the one where I had chemo but all the staff lovely. Haven't got my start date but should have it through the post soon. Wasfit@50 you will be fine it was a piece of cake x Angela x
Posts.Title: November 2018 Radiotherapy Thread

Posts.Content: ali owl Thanks for your good wishes x Weeblemum  I really enjoyed our meeting and yes we will definitely do it again. Leolady56  Am having PICC line fitted 31st July so will be in for my second round. Still needing to get this show on the road so long may this remain, I have my "Let Me At It" head on this morning and will report back later. You all play nicely x
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone. I guess being on day 9 I was expecting to start feeling capable again but have checked things out the unit have permission to OD on Gaviscon so have just stirred my lazy stumps and been to the chemist for a large box.  Gonna force myself to do something constructive this afternoon as I know I'll feel better if I do...nothing like housework or anything strenuous just some knitting I think.  Angela x
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Second day after chemo and still feeling pretty good, a bit sinusy and some huge ripe cherries just tasted so sharp they made my eyes water so changes going on there. Hoping the sickness stays away but have the pills ready for the first hint of it.  Had first injection done today by the district nurse and she is coming back tomorrow to watch me do one then I will do the rest...another little way I can do my bit to and feel useful!! Love to everyone on the train this month x x
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi Dizzy17 you have been a busy girl, hope that work was in an air-conditioned office. I guess every oncologist has his own ideas and that's fine by me just glad mine listened and has made the changes. Love and ice cream to everyone (too hot for hugs) Angela x
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Dizzy17 Hugs appreciated thanks x I slept 11 hours last night...should have me set up for today but can feel another lazy day coming on!!
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: How is it I don't seem to get any symptoms until I start taking the meds that are supposed to prevent them!! Hope you follow that...started fluconazole 50mg yesterday and developed sore bloated tummy and today I have sore tongue and nasty acid reflux!! Sorry to be moaning yet again but am fed up. Better go and suck a gaviscon.
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Leolady56 That made me smile and then shed a tear...first tears since this sorry business began so thanks another hurdle over x
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Oh Aliowl that is rubbish. They kept telling me to remind them and not go without them guess its cos they have to be in the fridge. A job you could do with eh!
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Had meeting with chemo nurse today she talked me through everything and I had blood tests. Had a look around the chemo suite and am all ready to start on Thursday. Lovely space, super nurses so I just need to sit there now and behave myself.  Hair cut booked for tomorrow morning then going to meet a lovely lady who I have met right here on this site. Will be fabulous to put a face to at least one of the names I have become familiar with and get and give a real hug x
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: lT is a very tactless thing to say and if you do throttle someone then serves them right.  The other day while talking to an acquaintance who knew that I had cancer, and was far more interested in telling me about a summer cold she was suffering from, asked me how I was getting on. I said I was starting chemo soon, to which she replied, that's sounds serious!! I said yes cancer is quite serious! Cannula should be ok, nurse said the veins are good but having had ANC I only have one arm to play with so a PICC line will be better in the long run.   Angela x
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Day six and I am suddenly exhausted, have slept nearly all day. Feeling hot a sticky but no temperature so I guess back to bed and sleep it off.
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hiya ladies, I had WLE and ANC on 12th June, oestrogen positive,Her2 negative, tumour was 18mm and dispatched with clear margins. 5 out of 12 lymph node tested positive putting me in the chemo camp. I had my appointment with oncologist on 28th June will be seeing chemo nurse this week and starting chemo next week. Feel like my feet haven't touched the ground but at least I can't grumble that I am being kept waiting. Nice to know there are others here who know what it's all about and I'm looking forward to sharing, supporting and leaning as we work our way through this. Angela x
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Got my start date Thursday 12th July so it's all getting a bit real now...eek!!!
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Good morning chemo buddies, I've been out for a short walk again this morning and am feeling good but always have some gaviscon in my pocket
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Maggie-Gaudigirl It was the tiredness, once the steroids were finished I think I coasted for 24 hours then I was exhausted slept nearly all day then slept another 11 hours that night. Next day again completely flat on my back. It wasn't unpleasant and I certainly wouldn't have wanted sickness instead but just goes to show that you must tell them what it was like for you and they can almost always make it better.  When do you start yours?
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Went to get a PICC line fitted today and after two hours of trying they gave up. Veins too tiny!! They were very kinds and extremely apologetic but leaves me with a second round of chemo to have on Thursday through a cannula, which was difficult last time. I am more than a little disappointed and am sporting a very sore arm not to mention aching elbow and shoulder from holding the awkward position for so long. Appointment is being made for a Port to be fitted before round 3. More than a little hacked off.
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi Betty Mango Was all a bit messy yesterday but after them telling me how much pain I was going to be in overnight and today because of the crazy position my arm was in for two hours I am pleased to report I have no pain at all and slept well. I am guessing that they are tiny from end to end and now have lots of bruising just above my elbow from repeated attempts yesterday to place the PICC line so not sure what they are going to do. Will drink lots, keep my arm warm and hope for the best. Angela x
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: I can understand your frustration with these advertisements, I feel uncomfortable when they pop up on TV and yes they make lots of money but isn’t that the whole point of this? The money, to support cancer sufferers and move towards a better outcome, would not be donated if these ads didn’t tug at the public’s heart strings. Angela x
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Hi NN, Had appointment with oncologist on Thursday 22nd November and chatted about Radiotherapy and signed the forms. He told me I'd get an appointment for planning within two weeks but in fact I got a call within 4 days this is when everything is calibrated and set in stone ready for the zapping, also you get your tattoo...everything happens so darn quickly but I'm not complaining. I believe that when I go tomorrow they will give me my start date but I could be wrong....will keep you up to date. Angela
Posts.Title: November 2018 Radiotherapy Thread

Posts.Content: Day 12 after 1st chemo and am feeling good. Am fortunate that my SE's were slight but still feel astonished at what has gone on in my body...it's been tough 12 days. Going to see Onco this afternoon and hope that blood has survived and that round 2 will go ahead as planned. Good luck to all going through this, it really is doable x
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi Aliowl No I didn't take any before but they did send some down the line before starting chemo. I was then sent home with enough tablets to take 2 twice a day for three days. Onco now suggesting I just take one the day after chemo and see how it goes. If I start to feel sick I can take another....this will still be halving what I took last time. He seems to think just one the day after chemo will do and I hope he's right because both the constipation and the exhaustion was not nice. He also suggested a spoonful of milled flax seed mixed in with breakfast cereal two days before chemo which I shall try. He's very keen not to push more drugs into bodies already over loaded with drugs and this is fine by me.
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Off for planning appointment tomorrow, just had a phone call much quicker then I expected so excited at the thought of maybe being finished before Christmas. So now I am officially a member of the Radiotherapy group x
Posts.Title: November 2018 Radiotherapy Thread

Posts.Content: You're ahead of me Betty Mango I haven't had planning session yet but still hoping to be done for Christmas. Enjoy your break in Cornwall x
Posts.Title: November 2018 Radiotherapy Thread

Posts.Content: Just like this one
Posts.Title: Temperature

Posts.Content: No problem Leolady56 don't feel rotten you encouraged me which at the time was great. Now what i want to know is how come my bloody veins are tiny when the rest of me is big!! Going to bed now to sleep the crap off and will be back in the morning fighting fit again!! Angela x
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: A digital one from Tesco £3
Posts.Title: Temperature

Posts.Content: Yes I took mine a couple of times a day and more if I felt rubbish. I was told to do this and think it's probably sound advice after reading poor  Rose2018's account of her week.
Posts.Title: Temperature

Posts.Content: Haven't been able to send a private message since the weekend. Worried that those who have messaged me will think I am rude or don't care because I haven't replied. Angela
Posts.Title: Technical issues - how to report.

Posts.Content: Done it and hope it helps. It's the opposite of helpful on here at the moment.
Posts.Title: Technical issues - how to report.

Posts.Content: Just beautiful Kathryn123 x
Posts.Title: Anyone else loving there wig

Posts.Content: My hair is falling with no help from drugs at all...just the stress of this business is making me shed like a moulting animal
Posts.Title: tamoxifen(Nolvadex-d) and hair lost - need comments please

Posts.Content: I am more worried about my nails than my hair. the hair is a given so I will deal with it but nails are a bit of a lottery. I've been told that nail varnish might help also keeping fingers in iced water during chemo session, I guess that works like the cold cap...anyway I am going to throw everything at it and hope for the best. Angela
Posts.Title: Nails lifting off!

Posts.Content: Hi Jax68  I am starting my injections today and have done two rounds previously. First round I got lower back pain that was quite sharp but found that a couple of paracetamol and an hour in bed eased it fine. Second course didn't affect my back at all but made me generally weak so always lay on the bed for a while afterwards...they are not nice but do a great job. Obviously if your back doesn't respond to pain meds and a lie down make that phone call to the experts to get more help and put your mind at rest. Love and hugs Angela x
Posts.Title: Zarzio injections

Posts.Content: Yes hot water bottle is great I used one but had forgotten...blooming chemo brain!!
Posts.Title: Zarzio injections

Posts.Content: How awful for you Pollymac. I had ultra sound, mammogram and biopsies just ten days after my routine mammogram was flagged up as dodgey. Two days later I had the results and a week after that I was talking with the surgeon. Had surgery on 12th June and yesterday was discharged from the surgical team and have had first oncology appointment today. The process doesn't have to take forever and you should make yourself heard about this.  Good luck Angela x
Posts.Title: Post mastectomy biopsy results, long wait

Posts.Content: Good morning Cham, sorry to hear that you have to have further surgery and that you are feeling so low. Five days ago I had ANC (axillary node clearance) would like to reassure you...the pain is has not been bad, paracetamol is the only pain meds I have taken and have not needed them regularly just taken a couple at night really. There is a lot of stiffness but exercises are slowly moving that forward and I will be glad to get rid of the drain tomorrow. It's ok to feel weepy, every new step is a leap into the unknown, but you will be fine. As for preparation I really don't know, I stumbled straight into it and have come out fighting so just go for it. I'm sure there will be others on here who will add their experiences and I wish you all the best. Angela x
Posts.Title: another lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Hi positivedad, I also had Fec-T  and sailed through the FEC without even needing sickness meds T was harder but I am out the other end now. I didn't have the pain that many talk about while on T was just totally wiped out so as you can see we are all different. Hope your wife sails through with few side effects but if not don't be afraid to ring that number, there is almost always something they can do to ease symptoms. Good luck Angela
Posts.Title: wife about to commence chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi Lottie8, I agree that at our age, I'm 68, we have sort of got used to being in charge of our lives but of course we are now out of our depth and need the team of wonderful people who are trying to help us. With their help WE CAN DO IT!!!! Angela
Posts.Title: Everything in my life topsy turvy !

Posts.Content: Saw my onco yesterday and complained about the brutal fatigue after stopping the steroids. He said they were to blame and as I had no sickness at all he is going to reduce them for my next round. I'll let you know how that goes but in the meantime just drink and sleep and know that in a day or so you'll feel better. You can do this nelly1 Too hot for hugs so sending ice cream instead
Posts.Title: Fatigue tiredness etc etc

Posts.Content: Glad to help my love x
Posts.Title: Fatigue tiredness etc etc

Posts.Content: ali owl, that is sensational and so very true, I'm going to steal that x x

Posts.Content: Lovely thought for today grannylara Hit the nail on the head for me as I go for my third chemo today. Surgery already done and soon half way through chemo...who would have thought I could have got this far x x

Posts.Content: No matter what kind of challenges or difficulties or painful situations you go through in your life, we all have something deep within us that we can reach down and find the inner strength to get through them. Alana Stewart

Posts.Content: Leolady56 ......OMG, that is a powerful one, just wonderful x
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: Fabulous!!!
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: Ain't that the truth Aliowl
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: We are here for you Ali, you really can do this x x
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: Yes, I had a little one at the end of my scar as well. Came away on it's own when it was ready. x
Posts.Title: Post op complications

Posts.Content: Found out today that my op will not be going ahead on 29th May but has been postponed until 12th June...another two weeks... I am gutted
Posts.Title: Op postponed!!

Posts.Content: Thank you Seaspirit44 for your encouragement. It didn't seem to be a bed shortage thing they said that someone else had to be given my slot...I guess if they were in more need than me then that's how it should be. I'll be ok once I've slept on it but it has rattled me to the core.
Posts.Title: Op postponed!!

Posts.Content: Thank you xjuliex for the hug, feeling more emotional this evening than any time since discovering this critter x
Posts.Title: Op postponed!!

Posts.Content: Thanks Weeblemum for the hugs, much appreciated x
Posts.Title: Op postponed!!

Posts.Content: Jacmatholmad I had a weekend at the seaside booked to keep me occupied until my op on Tuesday...I have just turned that into a whole week which should blow the cobwebs away and occupy me for some of the waiting time.
Posts.Title: Op postponed!!

Posts.Content: Hi Mrs50 my hair is growing back very quickly. I have had to have a severe clippering already and another one is booked as of course it's not growing evenly but it is getting very thick now. Last chemo was November 1st. I have been using a Lush shampoo bar that someone recommended and although I can't be completely sure the hair growth is a result of said bar it might be worth a try,  https://uk.lush.com/products/shampoo/new
Posts.Title: Hair returning - but should I get excited?

Posts.Content: Guess who backed the 100:1 outsider!!
Posts.Title: Caption Competition
